title: (x) "Buffalo Pawn" chamfered slab serif - Grecian {Rob Sutton}
content:
[http://www.marcenglishdesign.com/NEW/identity/buffalo\_pawn.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121325/http:/www.marcenglishdesign.com/NEW/identity/buffalo_pawn.html)

Can someone identify the “uffalo” part of this logotype?

(asking for font IDs at 6:30 in the morning. gosh that’s nerdy)

Enrico
author: enrico_limcaco

comments.content: Wooden Type Fonts also has a [Grecian](http://web.archive.org/web/20070329121325/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/grecian/?refby=typographica).

There was also a version made by NovelFonts, called ‘Greenwood’. My notes have it as equivalent to ‘Grecian Bold’ in the Solotype Catalog. Therefore I’d guess the Solotype font Rob picked would be virtually the same, which is good to know, because the NovelFonts are not to be found any more. (Sold as the Expresiv Ornate Font collection in the mid-1990’s.)

- Mike Yanega

Wonderful…thanks to everyone for their help!

Enrico

\> _(asking for font IDs at 6:30 in the morning. gosh that’s nerdy)_

Well, as we have identifiers from all over the globe, we provide 24 hour service, almost 7 days a week. So you ask for a font ID anytime you want. Nifty, innit? ;^)
